ADMINISTRATIVE LAW JUDGES RULING DIRECTING PARTIES TO FILE COMMENTS ON TARIFF ON-BILL PROPOSALS. SVCE shall notify the service list by April 22, 2025, with a request for the Commission to continue to consider its TOB proposal and have parties comment on it.  Parties are directed to consider the attached independent evaluators assessment of the proposals; and submit comments responsive to the question below by May 14, 2025.  No later than May 30, 2025, parties shall provide reply comments regarding the comments filed on May 14, 2025. No later than June 6, 2025, parties may request evidentiary hearing on contested issues, as appropriate.

DECISIONMAKER NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION. Syche Cai, Advisor to President Alice Reynolds, Karin Sung, Adviser to Commissioner Houck; Amanda Singh Birmingham, Advisor to Commissioner Houck log an ex parte meeting with Silicon Valley Clean Energy on November 25, 2024 at 9:30 am.

SILICON VALLEY CLEAN ENERGY AUTHORITY NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION In accordance with Rule 8.4 of the California Public Utilities Commission (Commission) Rules of Practice and Procedure, Silicon Valley Clean Energy Authority (SVCE) hereby provides notice of the following ex parte communication. On November 27, 2024, at 9:30 a.m., SVCE participated in a Webex videoconference with Commission President Reynolds and Commissioner Houcks offices.  The communication lasted approximately 30minutes.  The following individuals participated in the videoconference on behalf of the Commission: Syche Cai, Energy Advisor for President Reynolds; Karin Sung, Chief of Staff and Legal Advisor to Commissioner Houck; and Amanda Singh Birmingham, Deputy Chief of Staff and Energy Advisor to Commissioner Houck. The following individuals participated in the videoconference on behalf of SVCE: Jessamyn Allen, Programs Lead; Adam Pearse, Senior Regulatory Analyst; and for the Technology and Equipment for Clean Heating (TECH) implementation team: Dylan Voorhees, Senior Consultant for Vermont Energy Investment Corporation.

SILICON VALLEY CLEAN ENERGY AUTHORITYTHREE-DAY ADVANCE NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Pursuant to Rule 8.2(c)(2)(B) of the California Public Utilities Commission (Commission) Rules of Practice and Procedure, Silicon Valley Clean Energy Authority (SVCE)hereby gives advanced notice of a meeting with Syche Cai, Energy Advisor for Commission President Reynolds, Karin Sung, Chief of Staff and Legal Advisor for Commissioner Houck, and Amanda Singh, Energy Advisor for Commissioner Houck. The meeting is scheduled to occur on November 25, 2024at 9:30a.m. for approximately 30 minutes, and will be conducted via a Webex videoconference. Jessamyn Allen, Programs Lead for SVCE, Adam Pearse, Senior Regulatory Analyst for SVCE, and Dylan Voorhees for the Vermont Energy Investment Corporation are expected to participate in the meeting.  The purpose of the meeting is to discuss the joint Tariff On-Bill proposal filed by SVCE and the investor-owned utilities in this proceeding.

NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION OF THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT SUSTAINABLE ENERGY COALITION Pursuant to Public Utilities Code Section 1701.1(e)(3) and Rules 8.3 and 8.4 of the California Public Utilities Commission’s Rules of Practice and Procedure, the Local Government Sustainable Energy Coalition (LGSEC) files this notice of ex parte communication. On February 24, 2023 the LGSEC and Santa Barbara Clean Energy (SBCE) met through a conference call with Cheryl Wynn from 4:00-4:30pm. In attendance for LGSEC and SBCE were Gabriela Yamhure, LGSEC Project Manager; Steven Moss, LGSEC Regulatory Consultant; Alelia Parenteau, Acting Sustainability and Resiliency Director; and City of Santa Barbara Councilmember, Kristen Sneddon. The meeting was requested by the LGSEC and SBCE, and no written materials were provided.

Anand Durvasula, Interim Chief of Staff to President Reynolds; Kerry Fleisher, Interim Energy Policy Advisor to President Reynolds; Rosie O’Hara, Interim Legal and Policy Advisor to President Reynolds log an ex parte meeting with Center for Accessible Technology on September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION. Silicon Valley Clean Energy Authority reports an ex parte meeting with Joanna Perez-Green, Advisor to Commissioner Genevieve Shiroma on October 3, 2022 at 2:00 pm.

SILICON VALLEY CLEAN ENERGY AUTHORITY THREE-DAY ADVANCE NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Silicon Valley Clean Energy Authority (“SVCE”) hereby gives advanced notice of a meeting with Joanna Perez-Green, advisor to Commissioner Genevieve Shiroma on October 3, 2022 at 2:00 p.m. for approximately 30 minutes, and will be conducted via teleconference. Jessamyn Allen, Senior Programs Specialist for SVCE, various members of the VEIC and Technology and Equipment for Clean Heating (“TECH”) initiative, and other SVCE representatives are expected to attend on behalf of SVCE. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss key issues that should be addressed in the expected proposed decision in order mitigate risk and enhance the equity objective.

Description: CENTER FOR ACCESSIBLE TECHNOLOGY AND NATIONAL CONSUMER LAW CENTER’S NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Center for Accessible Technology (CforAT) and National Consumer Law Center (NCLC) notice of ex parte communications on September 22, 2022, CforAT and NCLC via WebEx including Anand Durvasula, Kerry Fleisher, and Roseanne O’Hara from the office of President Alice Reynolds; Melissa Kasnitz and Alexandra Green, participating on behalf of CforAT; and Olivia Wein, participating on behalf of NCLC. This meeting lasted approximately thirty minutes and on September 23, 2022, CforAT and NCLC via conference call including Cheryl Wynn and Joanna Perez-Green from the office of Commissioner Genevieve Shiroma; Melissa Kasnitz and Alexandra Green, participating on behalf of CforAT; and Olivia Wein, participating on behalf of NCLC. This meeting lasted twenty-four minutes.

Description: THREE-DAY ADVANCE NOTICE OF EX PARTE MEETING BY CENTER FOR ACCESSIBLE TECHNOLOGY AND NATIONAL CONSUMER LAW CENTER  Center for Accessible Technology (CforAT) and the National Consumer Law Center (NCLC) hereby provide three days’ notice of a granted ex parte meeting, with Kerry Fleisher and Roxanne O’Hara, Advisors to President Reynolds, on Thursday, September 22nd, 2022, scheduled for 10:30 am, for approximately 30 minutes. This meeting was originally scheduled for September 12th but was rescheduled due to a family emergency for one of the parties. Attending for CforAT will be Melissa W. Kasnitz, Legal Director and Alexandra Green, CforAT’s law fellow. Attending for NCLC will be Olivia Wein, Attorney. This meeting will be held virtually on Webex

ASSIGNED COMMISSIONER’S SCOPING MEMO AND RULING. The scope of this proceeding is described in Section 2 and is adopted. The schedule of this proceeding is set forth in Section 5 and is adopted. Evidentiary hearing may be needed. The category of the proceeding is ratesetting. Southern California Edison Company shall file a summary of existing investor-owned utility clean energy financing programs associated with the Commission proceedings listed in the table within Section 7, and other state, local, and regional clean energy financing programs the utilities currently coordinate with, on or before May 10, 2021. Each of the utilities shall host community meetings within their service territories during the fourth quarter of 2021. The utilities shall participate in any additional workshops scheduled by Energy Division in this rulemaking.
